newsitem.title: UK: Hong Kong stocks in London advance, banks lead.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks in London advance, banks lead.

text.p: Hong Kong shares trading in London were led higher on Tuesday by the bank sector, with HSBC Holdings taking centre stage. "We finished pretty much at the top of the day, with the outstanding feature being Hong Kong (& Shanghai) Bank," said one trader. "It was all on the back of the firm FTSE," he added.
The Hang Seng London Reference index closed 85.63 points higher at 13,535.71 following the Hang Seng's 57.20 point loss in Hong Kong overnight.
The FTSE 100 index was trading 47 points higher at 4,354.1 by 1613 GMT.

HSBC finished at HK$189.95 in London after a Hong Kong close of HK$186.5. Hang Seng Bank was also higher on the back of the rise in HSBC. The stock ended at HK$85.75 in London, up from HK$84.75 in Hong Kong.
Elsewhere, traders noted interest in Hong Kong Telecom which advanced to HK$13.875 in London from HK$13.750.
"We saw some good buying, and the stock is very firm in the ADR form in the States," one dealer said.
